title: Domestic Violence & Dowry Harassment - Gurugram
summary: A woman alleges abuse, demand for cash, and assault by husband and in-laws.

stages.info:
Complainant: Neha, 28.
Alleges harassment for ₹2 lakh & physical assault.
Medical bruises visible.
stages.question: First procedure?
options: Ensure medical MLC & record Section 161 statement promptly
Send complainant back to in-laws for compromise
stages.feedback_wrong: MLC + statement collection are legally required.
stages.next_info: MLC done; doctor confirms assault marks.

stages.info:
MLC confirms injuries.
Complainant alleges dowry demand for 2 years.
stages.question: Next step?
options: Register FIR under relevant IPC + Dowry Act sections
Tell her to bring evidence herself
stages.feedback_wrong: Dowry-related offences require timely FIR when prima facie made out.
stages.next_info: FIR registered against husband, mother-in-law & brother-in-law.

stages.info:
Accused not present at home.
Neighbour confirms frequent fights.
stages.question: Your action?
options: Issue notice u/s 41A CrPC where applicable
stages.feedback_wrong: 41A notice needed for procedural compliance unless arrest justified.
stages.next_info: 41A notices served; husband appears next day.

stages.info:
Husband appears; claims injuries were 'self-inflicted'.
No alibi.
stages.question: Next step?
options: Collect phone chats, bills, jewellery receipts as corroborative evidence
stages.next_info: Chats recovered showing repeated demands for money.

stages.info:
Chats show demand for money.
Woman feels unsafe.
stages.question: Next step?
options: Inform Women Help Desk & ensure safe shelter if needed

stages.question: Conclusion?
options: Complete chargesheet with medico-legal evidence & digital proof
